summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the voluntary interview of a Bureau of Prisons Material Handler, conducted on September 11, 2019, regarding his duties and the events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 9-10, 2019. The interview focuses on institutional counts, 30-minute rounds, staffing, and the specific shift when Epstein died.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The interview details his return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), feeding, and the circumstances leading up to his death.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: A corrections officer who worked the SHU shift with the interviewee on August 9, 2019. She was responsible for calling in the 10pm count and is described as being scared after Epstein's death.

persons.name: THOMAS
persons.context: A corrections officer who relieved the interviewee and NOEL at the end of their shift on August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Acting LT
persons.context: An acting lieutenant who was called to handle a suicide watch situation involving two other inmates in the SHU on the evening of August 9, 2019.

connections.description: NOEL was one of the corrections officers responsible for feeding Epstein and conducting counts/rounds in the SHU on the night of his death.
THOMAS relieved NOEL and the interviewee at the end of their shift on the night of Epstein's death.
LT was involved in staffing the SHU where Epstein was housed on the night of his death, pressuring the interviewee to work overtime there.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day in SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was returned to his cell in the SHU's L-Tier around 8pm, was fed a late meal, and was left without a cellmate. Critical institutional counts and rounds were not properly conducted during this shift.

events.title: Missed 10pm Institutional Count
events.description: The mandatory 10pm inmate count in the Special Housing Unit was not conducted on August 9, 2019. The count slip was signed but the count was not performed.

events.title: Suicide Watch Incident
events.description: Around 7:30pm, two inmates in the SHU threatened to hang themselves, requiring intervention from an Acting Lieutenant and placement on suicide watch.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Staff
events.description: A BOP Material Handler was interviewed by the FBI, OIG, and AUSAs regarding procedures and events at MCC leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Federal Law Enforcement Training Center (FLETC), Glynco, GA
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY)
keyFacts: The 10pm institutional count in the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, was not conducted, despite a count slip being signed by two officers.
Corrections officers at MCC were described as exhausted, 'zombie-like,' and frequently cutting corners on mandatory 30-minute inmate rounds due to burnout and excessive mandated overtime.
Jeffrey Epstein was returned to his SHU cell around 8pm on August 9 and was fed a late 'commonfare' or kosher meal. He was alone in his cell, as his cellmate had been released earlier that day.
Officer NOEL, who worked the shift with the interviewee, was described as scared and reluctant to talk about Epstein's death in subsequent conversations.
The interview reveals systemic issues at MCC, including inconsistent enforcement of rounds, fatigue among staff, and a culture where procedural shortcuts were common.
